paper.title: APPLICATION OF PORTFOLIO THEORY IN DECISION TREE ANALYSIS
paper.abstract: A general application of portfolio analysis for herd decision tree analysis is described. In the herd environment, this methodology offers a means of employing population-based decision strategies that can help the producer control economic variation in expected return from a given set of decision options. An economic decision tree model regarding the use of prostaglandin in dairy cows with undetected estrus was used to determine the expected return of the decisions to use prostaglandin and breed on a timed basis, use prostaglandin and then breed on sign of estrus, or breed on signs of estrus. The risk attributes of these decision alternatives were calculated from the decision tree, and portfolio theory was used to find the efficient decision combinations (portfolios with the highest return for a given variance). The resulting combinations of decisions could be used to control return variation.

domain_result.justification: 该论文应用了投资组合理论（portfolio theory）来分析农业决策树中的经济回报和风险，目的是找到高效的决策组合（portfolios with the highest return for a given variance），这属于投资组合管理的范畴。
